   Barack Obama
   stated on February 6, 2011 in an interview on Fox:
   Twelve judges have thrown out legal challenges to the health care law
   because they rejected "the notion that the health care law was
   unconstitutional."

true false
     * National
     * Health Care
     * Supreme Court
     * Barack Obama
   By Robert Farley February 8, 2011

President Obama says 12 judges have rejected "the notion that the health care
law was unconstitutional"

   Ever since a federal judge in Florida ruled the health care law
   unconstitutional, the White House has portrayed the opinion as an outlier
   made by an activist judge.

Besides the judges who dismissed 12 cases on procedural grounds, four
   judges have ruled on the merits of various cases challenging the health
   care law.

2010

   Sollars v. Reid, dismissed April 2, 2010

   Taitz v. Obama, dismissed April 14, 2010

   U.S. Citizens Association v. OMB, dismissed 8/2

   Bryant v. Holder, dismissed Feb. 3, 2011
